metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3145 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sanitize_cookie_path function in cURL and libcurl 7.31.0 through 7.41.0 does not properly calculate an index, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write and crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact via a cookie path containing only a double-quote character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.5
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.5
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.5
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.5').
